name: Elevate
headline: AI-powered data transformations for roll-ups
description:
We use AI to streamline data integrations for mergers & acquisitions (M&A), with a focus on private equity (PE)-backed roll-ups. We take messy data (e.g., customer, financial, operational) that sits across disparate systems in different formats and use LLMs to unify, clean, and enrich it. Our approach expedites speed to value capture post-acquisition without distracting management teams or requiring expensive data engineering resources. 

Our experience is at the intersection of finance x tech. With an increasingly competitive M&A marketplace driven by $0.5T+ of dry powder, clean, usable data is a massive competitive advantage throughout the investment cycle – in diligence, to make informed investment decisions; in value creation, to execute the strategic plan quickly and confidently; and in exit, where better data leads to better outcomes.  We’re on a mission to make AI useful for any company with messy data.
tags: industry:aiops; industry:artificial-intelligence; industry:finance; industry:b2b; industry:automation; location:new-york

founders.name: Scott Cara, Founder
founders.description:
Scott is the co-founder and CEO of Elevate AI. 

Scott was previously a consumer investor at Sycamore Partners where he partnered with 
c-suite executives at leading companies to drive growth. Prior to Sycamore, Scott was a management consultant at Bain & Co. 

Scott studied Computer Science and Mathematics at Duke University and holds an MBA from Harvard Business School.

generated_description:
**Elevate: Transforming Messy Data into Actionable Insights**

Founded in 2024 as part of the Y Combinator Batch S24, Elevate is a New York-based startup with a focused mission: to harness AI-powered data transformations specifically for private equity-backed roll-ups in the M&A landscape. With a lean team of two, Elevate is positioned at the intersection of finance and technology—a sweet spot considering the staggering $0.5 trillion in dry powder floating around the M&A marketplace.

### The Problem and the Solution

Mergers and acquisitions often come with a common headache: messy data splattered across various systems and formats. Elevate aims to tidy up this chaos using sophisticated AI models, particularly large language models (LLMs). The process is straightforward: you provide your disorganized data, and Elevate’s platform unifies, cleans, and enriches it. This means that companies can swipe away the distracting complexities of data tangles and focus on what truly matters—driving value from their acquisitions.

By streamlining data integrations, Elevate accelerates the speed to value capture post-acquisition. This isn’t just a nice-to-have; it pivots companies from unclear insights to confident decision-making in all stages of the investment cycle—from due diligence to exiting for maximum gain.

### Why It Matters

Clean, usable data is not just a technical advantage; it's a strategic one that can significantly differentiate firms in a crowded investment space. Better data translates into informed decisions during diligence, sharper execution of strategic plans during value creation, and ultimately leads to improved outcomes at exit.

### The Founders and the Vision

The company is led by Scott Cara, a former VP at Sycamore Partners with a strong background in driving growth through M&A, and Steve Mazzari, a tech-savvy CTO who has engineering roots at notable companies like Meta and GE Digital. They’re on a mission to make AI not just a buzzword but a practical tool for companies grappling with data chaos.

### The Future

As Elevate continues to evolve, they aim to expand their offerings and drive broader applications of AI in the finance sector. Their ambition? To empower any company struggling with messy data to find clarity and convert it into competitive advantages.

If you’re interested in seeing how Elevate can help your organization refine its data processes, check out their website at [useelevate.dev](https://www.useelevate.dev/).

In a world awash with data, Elevate is one of the few companies that might just have the answer to achieving clarity and actionable insights.
